title: Case Statements
description: Learn to use case statements for cleaner multi-way branching

content.introduction:
When you need to check a variable against many different values, using multiple if-else statements can become messy. The `case` statement provides a cleaner, more readable way to handle these situations.

In this lesson, you'll learn how to use case statements to make your code more elegant and maintainable.

### What You'll Learn
- Basic case statement syntax
- Handling multiple values per case
- Using ranges in case statements
- The else clause for default cases
- When to use case vs if-else

exercises.title: Month Name Display
exercises.description: Write a program that takes a month number (1-12) and displays the month name using a case statement.
hints: Create a case for each month number (1-12)
Add an else clause for invalid numbers

exercises.title: Season Detector
exercises.description: Create a program that determines the season based on month number. Winter: 12,1,2; Spring: 3,4,5; Summer: 6,7,8; Fall: 9,10,11
hints: Use commas to list multiple values in one case
Group months by season: 12,1,2 for Winter, etc.
Remember the semicolon after each case

exercises.title: Traffic Light Controller
exercises.description: Write a program that displays an action based on traffic light color: 'R' or 'r' = Stop, 'Y' or 'y' = Slow down, 'G' or 'g' = Go
hints: Use a Char variable for the color
Use commas to list both cases together
Add an else for invalid input

exercises.title: Age Group Classifier
exercises.description: Classify age into groups using ranges: 0-2: Baby, 3-12: Child, 13-19: Teenager, 20-64: Adult, 65+: Senior
hints: Use a reasonable upper limit for senior (e.g., 120)
Add else for values outside all ranges

content.summary:
Excellent! You've learned:

- **Case statement syntax**: A cleaner alternative to multiple if-else statements
- **Multiple values**: Grouping several values in one case using commas
- **Ranges**: Matching ranges of values with '..' notation
- **Else clause**: Handling unmatched values
- **Begin-end blocks**: Executing multiple statements in a case

Case statements make code more readable when checking one variable against many values!
content.nextSteps: Next, you'll learn about **loops** - how to repeat code multiple times. You'll start with `while` loops that repeat as long as a condition is true!
